justification: “Participants were asked to rate how much they would like to eat each food ‘right now’. The rating scale ranged from 0 to 100, corresponding to ratings from ‘Not at all’ to ‘Very much!’”
“For each set, participants were asked: ‘if someone likes one of the foods, how likely is it that they also similarly like the other foods?’ The rating scale ranged from 1 to 100.”

measured_by: average subgraph strength in association network
justification: “We then computed set-level scores for each subgraph. … The average strength of a subgraph indicates the magnitude of connections between the nodes. In our context, a higher average strength indicates stronger correlations between food items.”

measured_by: principal components of network centrality measures (PC1 & PC2)
justification: “Given the range of possible measures available, we used a principal component analysis… PCs 1 and 2 jointly account for more than 80% of the total variances in centrality measures… these two PCs act as our network scores for our behavioral analysis.”
